level.heading: Application of chapter to nonresident subject to personal jurisdiction.
level.text: A tribunal of the District exercising personal jurisdiction over a nonresident in a proceeding under this chapter, under other law of the District relating to a support order, or recognizing a support order of a foreign country or political subdivision on the basis of comity may receive evidence from another state pursuant to § 46-303.16, communicate with a tribunal of another state pursuant to § 46-303.17, and obtain discovery through a tribunal of another state pursuant to § 46-303.18. In all other respects, subchapters III through VII of this chapter do not apply and the tribunal shall apply the procedural and substantive law of the District.

level.heading: Effective Dates
level.text: Applicability: Section 3 of D.C. Law 16-137 provided: "This act shall apply as of April 1, 2007."

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 210 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act).
